alert.note: Alert for Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox (Arizona) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 26 at 2:13PM MST by NWS Tucson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northeastern Cochise County through 245 PM MST... At 212 PM MST, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Chiricahua National Monument, or 21 miles northwest of Rodeo, moving north at 10 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Chiricahua National Monument. This includes the following highways... Route 181 between mile markers 60 and 64. Route 186 between mile markers 357 and 359. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Chiricahua Mountains including Chiricahua National Monument; Eastern Cochise County Below 5000 Feet including Douglas, Willcox
